meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support clothing or carry weapons.
meanings.sent1: She fastened her sword to the belting before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy's belting matched his boots perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer created a belting made entirely of recycled materials.
meanings.sent4: The belting of the knight gleamed in the sunlight as he rode into the castle.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the belting caught everyone's attention at the fashion show.

meanings.sent1: The bully gave the poor kid a harsh belting in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The criminal received a belting from the police for his crimes.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy got a playful belting on its behind for chewing the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The storm unleashed a belting of rain on the city, causing flooding.
meanings.sent5: The boxer delivered a powerful belting to his opponent, winning the match.

meanings.definition: A continuous band of material used in machinery for transmitting motion.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers replaced the worn-out belting on the conveyor belt.
meanings.sent2: The engine's belting was crucial for the smooth operation of the vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making a rabbit disappear using a loop of belting.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of the belting in the engine signaled that everything was working properly.
meanings.sent5: The old clock tower stopped ticking when the belting connecting the gears snapped.
